alert.note: Alert for Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 19 at 12:39PM EST until February 22 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Wills Creek At Cambridge affecting Guernsey County. Stillwater Creek At Uhrichsville affecting Tuscarawas County. Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC157-200315- /O.CON.KPBZ.FL.W.0008.000000T0000Z-220223T0200Z/ /URVO1.2.ER.220217T2239Z.220219T0645Z.220222T2000Z.NO/ 1239 PM EST Sat Feb 19 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stillwater Creek at Uhrichsville. * WHEN...Until late Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Stillwater Creek comes out of its banks in several locations resulting in overflowing in poor drainage areas. Minor flooding of low lying areas begins. At 11.5 feet, Flood waters of Stillwater Creek will reach the intersection of East 12th Street and North Main Street in Uhrichsville and approach Newport Street. Little Stillwater Creek will flood most of Phac Park along with portions of Wilson Road in Dennison. At 12.9 feet, Numerous low land areas are flooded. Stillwater Creek begins to flood portions of Newport Street in Uhrichsville. Homes along Park Drive begin to flood. Sections of Wilson Road near Phac Park are flooded. At 13.3 feet, Flood waters reach Newport Avenue in Uhrichsville as well as East 12th Street and North Main Street half way to East 11th Street. Phac Park along Little Stillwater Creek in Dennison is flooded. At 17.8 feet, Flooding occurs in the west and north side of Uhrichsville (Main Street, West 5th Street, the east end of 4th Street, and the east end of Franklin Street.) Also flooded are areas in Uhrichsville and Dennison along Little Stillwater Creek and the west end of Newport. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 12:00 PM EST Saturday the stage was 15.9 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 12:00 PM EST Saturday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to continue falling, and should fall below flood stage Tuesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
